sentences.sentence: Hungary vows to keep up its veto of Ukraine's EU membership talks ahead of a crucial leaders' summit in Brussels on Thursday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Tensions are growing in the EU over Hungary's resistance towards opening up Ukraine's membership talks to join the bloc.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: At a meeting of EU foreign affairs ministers on Monday, Hungary dug its heels in on the issue, angering many other member states that would like to speed up Ukraine's accession process.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: The only way I can read Hungarian position, not just on Ukraine, but on many other issues, is that they are against Europe and everything that Europe stands for.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: At a crucial summit of EU.U. leaders in Brussels on Thursday, the issue of membership will be debated, and also on giving Ukraine an additional 50 billion euros in financial support, a lifeline for a country defending itself against Russia's invasion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Hungary is currently blocking both issues.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Ukraine's Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba, who was also in the Belgian capital, says the stakes are very high for both sides.

sentences.sentence: I cannot imagine, I don't even want to talk about the devastating consequences that will occur shall the council fail to make this decision, not only with regard to Ukraine, but in a broader sense on the issue of enlargement as a whole.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: But Hungary is vowing to maintain its veto as it says Kiev is not ready to join the EU, blaming the European Commission for making what it calls a false evaluation of the situation in Ukraine. Our position is clear. Currently, the situation is not given, the situation is not ready for the European Union to start joint negotiations with Ukraine. And this is not a tactical position, but a well-founded position.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Kiev says it's fulfilled the EU's demands to begin talks in record speed, particularly in regard to the fight against corruption and justice reforms.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelensky is set to meet his U.S. counterpart in Washington after a stop in Argentina for a swearing-in ceremony of its new president.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: The visit to the White House comes as Joe Biden's administration is attempting to step up pressure on Congress to provide billions more in aid to Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, relatives and supporters of soldiers taken prisoner by Russia after fighting in Maripol took to the streets of Kyiv demanding the return of their loved ones.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: Some of the protesters were former prisoners themselves. As fighting continues on the ground in Ukraine, Zelensky had what he described as a frank conversation with Hungary's prime minister. sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: One, how high is our ambition on mitigation? And two, are we willing to back this transition with the proper means of support to deliver it?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: A coalition of more than 80 countries has been pushing for an agreement that includes language to phase out fossil fuels. But they face tough opposition from oil-producing countries, despite the fact scientists say it's crucial to slow down global warming.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_17
sentences.sentence: The United Nations has urged world leaders to revive the spirit of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, as the international body marks the 75th anniversary of the landmark text.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_17
sentences.sentence: It was adopted after the horrors of World War II in an effort to establish the supremacy of individual rights and freedoms.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_17
sentences.sentence: In a speech in Geneva, the UN Human Rights hailed its achievement, but acknowledged its failings.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_17
sentences.sentence: Alongside the progress that has transformed many of our societies there have also been numerous failures to uphold human rights over the past 75 years we live among such failures today with the turmoil and suffering that they produce war the assembly observed a moment of silence for millions of victims of rights violations around the world.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_17
sentences.sentence: They include people caught in the current wars in the Middle East and Ukraine and other global conflicts.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: On Sunday 10th December, artists from around the world gathered in Geneva, Switzerland to mark the 75th anniversary of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights. The concert brought together artists like UNICEF at Goodwill Ambassador Angelique Kidjo and UNHCR Lifetime Ambassador of Goodwill Barbara Hendricks, among others. Emmy Award-winning actor Billy Porter also featured in a pre-recorded performance from London.
